00019 struct Segment
00020 {
00021   double alpha;

00025 struct Coord_compare: public std::binary_function<const coord_type*, const coord_type*, bool>
00026 {
00027   result_type operator() (first_argument_type p, second_argument_type q) const
00028   {
00029     if (p->ycoord < q->ycoord)
00030       return true;
00031 
00032     if (p->ycoord > q->ycoord)
00033       return false;
00034 
00035     return (p->xcoord < q->xcoord);
00036   }
00037 };
00038 
00039 typedef std::list<Segment> Segment_list;
00040 typedef std::map<const coord_type*, Segment_list, Coord_compare> Segment_array;
00041 typedef std::vector<const Segment*> Segment_vector;

00043 bounding_box::bounding_box(const coord_type* p): ver(p)
00044 {
00045 }
00046 
00047 double* bounding_box::operator()(double* bb, int n) const
00048 {
00049   const coord_type* p = &ver[n];
00050   if (p->xcoord < bb[0]) bb[0] = p->xcoord;
00051   if (p->ycoord < bb[1]) bb[1] = p->ycoord;
00052   if (p->xcoord > bb[2]) bb[2] = p->xcoord;
00053   if (p->ycoord > bb[3]) bb[3] = p->ycoord;
00054   return bb;
00055 }
00056 
00057 double* bounding_box::max(double *bb)
00058 {
00059   bb[0] = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
00060   bb[1] = bb[0];
00061   bb[2] = -bb[0];
00062   bb[3] = bb[2];
00063   return bb;
00064 }
00065 
00066 double* bounding_box::init(const coord_type& p, double *bb)
00067 {
00068   bb[0] = bb[2] = p.xcoord;
00069   bb[1] = bb[3] = p.ycoord;
00070   return bb;
00071 }
00072 
00073 double* curve_bbox(const vertex_type& ver, const curve_type& cur, double bb[4])
00074 {
00075   return std::accumulate(++cur.begin(), cur.end(), \
00076     bounding_box::init(ver[cur.front()], bb), bounding_box(&ver[0]));
00077 }
00078 
00079 double* closed_curve_bbox(const vertex_type& ver, const curve_type& cur, double bb[4])
00080 {
00081   assert(is_closed(cur));
00082   curve_type::const_iterator it = ++cur.begin();
00083   bounding_box::init(ver[*it++], bb);
00084   return std::accumulate(it, cur.end(), bb, bounding_box(&ver[0]));
00085 }

00087 bool is_empty(const curve_type& cur)
00088 {
00089   return cur.empty();
00090 }

00092 bool is_point(const curve_type& cur)
00093 {
00094   return (cur.size() == 1);
00095 }
00096 
00097 bool is_segment(const curve_type& cur)
00098 {
00099   return (cur.size() == 2);
00100 }
00101 
00102 bool is_closed(const curve_type& cur)
00103 {
00104   // assert(cur.size() > 2);
00105   return (cur.front() == cur.back());
00106 }

00108 // hint: is this precondition violated, try one of the following ways
00109 // 1) apply std::unique(cur) method
00110 // 2) build lexord dictionary from original data
00111 bool has_duplicate_points(const vertex_type& ver, const curve_type& cur)
00112 {
00113   assert(cur.size() > 1);
00114   curve_type::const_iterator c = cur.begin();
00115   const coord_type* p = &ver[*c];
00116   while (++c != cur.end())
00117   {
00118     const coord_type* q = &ver[*c];
00119     if (p->xcoord == q->xcoord && p->ycoord == q->ycoord)
00120     {
00121       return true;
00122     }
00123     p = q;
00124   }
00125   return false;
00126 }
00127 
00128 bool has_degenerate_segment(const vertex_type& ver, const curve_type& cur)
00129 {
00130   assert(cur.size() > 2);
00131   curve_type::const_iterator c = cur.begin();
00132   const coord_type* p1 = &ver[*c++];
00133   const coord_type* p2 = &ver[*c];
00134   while (++c != cur.end())
00135   {
00136     const coord_type* p3 = &ver[*c];
00137     Classify c = classify(p1->xcoord, p1->ycoord, p2->xcoord, p2->ycoord, p3->xcoord, p3->ycoord);
00138     if (c == BEHIND || c == BETWEEN || c == ORIGIN || c == DESTINATION)
00139     {
00140       return true;
00141     }
00142     p1 = p2;
00143     p2 = p3;
00144   }
00145   return false;
00146 }
00147 
00148 // all segments aligned along common guide line
00149 bool is_degenerate_curve(const vertex_type& ver, const curve_type& cur)
00150 {
00151   if (!cur.empty())
00152   {
00153     curve_type::const_iterator c = cur.begin();
00154     const coord_type* p1 = &ver[*c++];
00155     const coord_type* p2 = &ver[*c];
00156     while (++c != cur.end())
00157     {
00158       const coord_type* p3 = &ver[*c];
00159       Classify c = classify(p1->xcoord, p1->ycoord, p2->xcoord, p2->ycoord, p3->xcoord, p3->ycoord);
00160       if (c == LEFT || c == RIGHT)
00161       {
00162         return false;
00163       }
00164       p1 = p2;
00165       p2 = p3;
00166     }
00167   }
00168   return true;
00169 }
00170 
00171 void plot_curve(const vertex_type& ver, const curve_type& cur)
00172 {
00173   psstream out("curve.ps");
00174   out.selectmedia(psstream::FORMAT_A4, psstream::PORTRAIT);
00175   out.newpage();
00176 
00177   double bb[4];
00178   std::accumulate(++cur.begin(), cur.end(), \
00179     bounding_box::init(ver[cur.front()], bb), bounding_box(&ver[0]));
00180 
00181   double x0, y0, sx, sy;
00182   double dx = bb[2] - bb[0], dy = bb[3] - bb[1];
00183   double pg_width = out.pagewidth();
00184   double pg_height = out.pageheight();
00185   double pg_margin = 40.0;
00186   double px = pg_width - 2.0 * pg_margin;
00187   double py = pg_height - 2.0 * pg_margin;
00188   if (px * dy < py * dx)
00189   {
00190     x0 = pg_margin;
00191     sx = px;
00192     sy = px * dy / dx;
00193     y0 = 0.5 * (pg_height - sy);
00194   }
00195   else
00196   {
00197     y0 = pg_margin;
00198     sy = py;
00199     sx = py * dx / dy;
00200     x0 = 0.5 * (pg_width - sx);
00201   }
00202   if (dx > 0.0) sx /= dx;
00203   if (dy > 0.0) sy /= dy;
00204   x0 -= bb[0] * sx;
00205   y0 -= bb[1] * sy;
00206 
00207   curve_type::const_iterator s = cur.begin();
00208   const coord_type* p = &ver[*s];
00209   out.moveto(x0 + sx * p->xcoord, y0 + sy * p->ycoord);
00210   while (++s != cur.end())
00211   {
00212     p = &ver[*s];
00213     out.lineto(x0 + sx * p->xcoord, y0 + sy * p->ycoord);
00214   }
00215   out.stroke();
00216 
00217   /*
00218   for (s = cur.begin(); s != cur.end(); ++s)
00219   {
00220     p = &ver[*s];
00221     out.arc(x0 + sx * p->xcoord, y0 + sy * p->ycoord, 0.5, 0.0, 360.0);
00222     out.fill();
00223   }
00224   */
00225 }
00226 
00227 static bool find_crossing(const vertex_type& ver, const curve_type& cur, \
00228   Segment_array& arr)
00229 {
00230   double a_max = 2.0 * M_PI;
00231   for (curve_type::const_iterator p = cur.begin(), q = p; ++q != cur.end(); p = q)
00232   {
00233     const coord_type* p1 = &ver[*p], *p2 = &ver[*q];
00234     curve_type::const_iterator t = q, s = t++;
00235     while (t != cur.end())
00236     {
00237       double u, v;
00238       const coord_type* q1 = &ver[*s], *q2 = &ver[*t];
00239       if (SKEW_CROSS == cross(p1->xcoord, p1->ycoord, p2->xcoord, p2->ycoord, \
00240         q1->xcoord, q1->ycoord, q2->xcoord, q2->ycoord, &u, &v) \
00241         && (0.0 != u && 1.0 != u || 0.0 != v && 1.0 != v))
00242       {
00243         return true;
00244       }
00245       s = t++;
00246     }
00247 
00248     double a = atan2(p1->ycoord - p2->ycoord, p1->xcoord - p2->xcoord);
00249     if (a < 0.0) a += a_max;
00250 
00251     arr[p2].push_back(Segment());
00252     Segment* g = &arr[p2].back();
00253     g->alpha = a;
00254     g->outgoing = false;
00255 
00256     a += M_PI;
00257     if (a >= a_max) a -= a_max;
00258 
00259     arr[p1].push_back(Segment());
00260     g = &arr[p1].back();
00261     g->alpha = a;
00262     g->outgoing = true;
00263   }
00264   return false;
00265 }
00266 
00267 bool is_self_crossed(const vertex_type& ver, const curve_type& cur)
00268 {
00269   if (is_closed(cur) || has_duplicate_points(ver, cur))
00270     return true;
00271 
00272   Segment_array arr;
00273   if (find_crossing(ver, cur, arr))
00274   {
00275     return true;
00276   }
00277 
00278   for (Segment_array::iterator it = arr.begin(); it != arr.end(); ++it)
00279   {
00280     if (it->second.size() > 2)
00281     {
00282       return true;
00283     }
00284   }
00285   return false;
00286 }
00287 
00288 bool is_simple(const vertex_type& ver, const curve_type& cur)
00289 {
00290   assert(is_closed(cur));
00291   assert(!has_duplicate_points(ver, cur));
00292   
00293   Segment_array arr;
00294   if (find_crossing(ver, cur, arr))
00295   {
00296     // plot_curve(ver, cur);
00297     return false;
00298   }
00299   for (Segment_array::iterator it = arr.begin(); it != arr.end(); ++it)
00300   {
00301     if (it->second.size() > 2)
00302     {
00303       return false;
00304     }
00305   }
00306   return true;
00307 }
00308 
00309 static inline const Segment* address(const Segment& z)
00310 {
00311   return &z;
00312 }
00313 
00314 static inline bool alpha_compare(const Segment* p, const Segment* q)
00315 {
00316   return (p->alpha < q->alpha);
00317 }
00318 
00319 bool is_weakly_simple(const vertex_type& ver, const curve_type& cur)
00320 {
00321   Segment_array arr;
00322   if (find_crossing(ver, cur, arr))
00323   {
00324     return false;
00325   }
00326   for (Segment_array::iterator it = arr.begin(); it != arr.end(); ++it)
00327   {
00328     if (it->second.size() > 2)
00329     {
00330       Segment_vector adj(it->second.size());
00331       std::transform(it->second.begin(), it->second.end(), adj.begin(), address);
00332       std::sort(adj.begin(), adj.end(), alpha_compare);
00333       const Segment* prev = adj.back();
00334       for (Segment_vector::iterator s = adj.begin(); s != adj.end(); ++s)
00335       {
00336         const Segment* curr = *s;
00337         if (prev->outgoing == curr->outgoing)
00338         {
00339           return false;
00340         }
00341         prev = curr;
00342       }
00343     }
00344   }
00345   return true;
00346 }
00347 
00348 bool is_convex(const vertex_type& ver, const curve_type& cur)
00349 {
00350   assert(is_simple(ver, cur));
00351   curve_type::const_iterator prev = cur.begin(), curr = prev;
00352   bool classified = false;
00353   Classify global;
00354   while (++curr != cur.end())
00355   {
00356     curve_type::const_iterator next = curr;
00357     if (++next == cur.end())
00358       next = ++cur.begin();
00359 
00360     Classify local = classify(ver[*prev].xcoord, ver[*prev].ycoord,
00361       ver[*curr].xcoord, ver[*curr].ycoord, ver[*next].xcoord, ver[*next].ycoord);
00362     if (local != BEYOND)
00363     {
00364       assert(local == LEFT || local == RIGHT);
00365       if (classified)
00366       {
00367         if (global != local)
00368         {
00369           return false;
00370         }
00371       }
00372       else
00373       {
00374         classified = true;
00375         global = local;
00376       }
00377     }
00378     prev = curr;
00379   }
00380   return true;
00381 }
00382 
00383 double area(const vertex_type& ver, const curve_type& cur)
00384 {
00385   assert(is_weakly_simple(ver, cur));
00386   double a = 0.0;
00387   curve_type::const_iterator prev = cur.begin(), curr = prev;
00388   while (++curr != cur.end())
00389   {
00390     curve_type::const_iterator next = curr;
00391     if (++next == cur.end())
00392       next = ++cur.begin();
00393     a += ver[*curr].xcoord * (ver[*next].ycoord - ver[*prev].ycoord);
00394     prev = curr;
00395   }
00396   return (0.5 * a);
00397 }
00398 
00399 bool is_counter_clockwise(const vertex_type& ver, const curve_type& cur)
00400 {
00401   return area(ver, cur) > 0.0;
00402 }
00403 
00404 bool is_generalized_polygon(const vertex_type& ver, const edge_type& pgn)
00405 {
00406   Segment_array arr;
00407   for (edge_type::const_iterator e = pgn.begin(); e != pgn.end(); ++e)
00408   {
00409     if (find_crossing(ver, *e, arr))
00410     {
00411       return false;
00412     }
00413   }
00414   for (Segment_array::iterator it = arr.begin(); it != arr.end(); ++it)
00415   {
00416     if (it->second.size() > 2)
00417     {
00418       Segment_vector adj(it->second.size());
00419       std::transform(it->second.begin(), it->second.end(), adj.begin(), address);
00420       std::sort(adj.begin(), adj.end(), alpha_compare);
00421       const Segment* prev = adj.back();
00422       for (Segment_vector::iterator s = adj.begin(); s != adj.end(); ++s)
00423       {
00424         const Segment* curr = *s;
00425         if (prev->outgoing == curr->outgoing)
00426         {
00427           return false;
00428         }
00429         prev = curr;
00430       }
00431     }
00432   }
00433   return true;
00434 }
